website_summaries.verdict: While active (and some stubbornly determined) dogs can work these boots off, they strap on nice and snug and protect paws from the elements.
pros: Provide very good protection from hot pavement, rough terrain, and slippery floors
Fit well, and straps attach snugly
cons: Boots can easily fall off active dogs’ paws
Some owners report irritated paw pads or nails after use
Can wear out fast with extended outdoor use

customer_reviews.title: I was so happy that i finally found something that fits my pomeranian
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy that i finally found something that fits my pomeranian, then i used it once and i saw some scratches on my pom's skin, i thought maybe it happened before, so today i used these shoes again, since it's raning so bad in seattle, and this is what i get (look at the picture). The material is so hard that it easily scratch his skin and it starts bleeding, i feel so bad now, he couldn't say anything i walked him for 10-15 min like that, i wouldn't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: faran

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: These booties did not work for my Doberman. In fact, they actually harmed her by creating a huge open sore on one of her paws! I used them just a few times. The company followed up with me to see how "happy" I was, and when I wrote back that I was a very unhappy customer, I heard NOTHING BACK FROM THEM EVER AGAIN! Poor customer service. I am returning my booties for a full refund, but my poor dog is still left with a painful open sore! Bad!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Update. Took my dog on an 8 miler today and he came back with bloody paws. Both back paws looked like this and the front had similar but not as bad raw spots. All 4 feet effected though.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Williams

customer_reviews.title: These have been great! We bought the largest size for Tango (he ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a service dog, and as such he's out in the hot summer, on concrete and asphalt every single day. We don't want his feet to burn so he wears shoes. We had tried a few from local stores, but could not find any big enough or that stayed on. These have been great! We bought the largest size for Tango (he is almost 1yr and 76lbs). They stay on and provide excellent protection and grip.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after 2 weeks!!! See photos. Product doesn't stay on and reviews are solicited.
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fell apart after just 2 weeks of use!!! I'm glad I waited to revise my review see the photos attached. Verified Amazon buyer so upset for $36!! I also received numerous requests by the seller to post a review. Many of these reviews are this which explains the higher than average quantity or ratings had I known this I would have read the reviews in more detail.
customer_reviews.author: sparkey

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ever
customer_reviews.text: Finally boots that stay on. Bought the small for my 20 lb. Cavachon. They are easy to put on and with double Velcro straps, they stay on. My dog wouldn't move at first but with a little practice in the house he can now run in them. Best of all, his feet stay dry and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design
customer_reviews.text: If I could give zero stars I would. These are terribly designed. I followed the sizing instructions and the shoes fit. But the top edge of the shoes rubbed by dogs paw raw and made it bleed. I’ve cleaned up the wound but that the shoes would even do this in the first place is awful. No matter how I adjusted the straps they wouldn’t stay on properly. And I just don’t recommend anyone buy these. I’m very surprised at the high rating anyone would give these shoes. It’s like they didn’t consider the actual shape of a dogs paws and legs.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Depending on what you're buying them for they could be great, they just don't hold up for me
customer_reviews.text: They fit perfectly, unfortunately they keep falling off as soon as we do anything more than walk on paved sidewalk. They don't seem to hold up to Chicago snowfall. Depending on what you're buying them for they could be great, they just don't hold up for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Hallelujah! Finally, dog shoes that don't fly off when the pups run!
customer_reviews.text: Finally! I went through four (4) different pairs on Amazon. Had to send them all back. I have two very active pups and when they start to run the shoes go flying. I have one pup that has very sensitive paws. 20 minutes walk turns into raw feet. THANK YOU for these!
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: It's got to be the shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Oliver was the star of the Sedona hiking trails in his Dog Shoes. Rough rocks, thorns, puddles, no problems!
customer_reviews.author: matthew v voigt

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, comfortable, and durable doggy shoes
customer_reviews.text: My baby is a 1.5 year old ShihTzu, weights 14 bls. Size 1 fits her perfectly. One size up would be too big. Shoes stays intact as she walked in them. the material is very soft, the velcro straps are good quality, and sole seems durable that will last a while. All in all, I believe this will last her for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and skip this idea if you have a large ( 100+ lb) dog.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Cheap 2. Fairly strong material 3. Rubber tread is made for decent traction Cons: 1. Dog hates them. 2. Slips off easily unless you strap it so tight the dog paw nearly looses circulation. 3. No real venting. My dogs paws were sweating profusely after 15mins of use in 70F. 4. Inside lining will rub raw spots on dogs paws; especially in wet conditions. 5. Improperly shaped for all four paws.
customer_reviews.author: My 2 Cents

customer_reviews.title: Material Bundles Up Making Them Too Stiff To Bend When Tightening Velcro Straps
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are too stiff and do not so that my Papillon/Yorkie cannot bend his paws. The dog weighs 9 1/2 lbs. I sent an email to My Busy Dog asking for help after calling them and requesting a return call (I did include my phone number) and did not receive a response. I checked the shoes and found that as the straps tighten to hold them on the legs the material bundles up making the shoes more difficult to bend. The one star is for the non-response by the family owned company.
customer_reviews.author: Avenger IV

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: This has provided true support for our yellow lab. We recently found out that he has osteosarcoma in his shoulder, causing him to limp and only use 3 legs. We use the shoe on his bad foot and he's able to grip the floors instead of sliding around. These shoes are worth the money and a lifesaver for us right now! We have a routine-we take the shoe off when he goes outside since leaves and acorns will get into the shoe, and as soon as he comes inside we put the shoe on! He's our best buddy so we are very pleased that he's doing well with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: BLH

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly durable shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: I have an 100lb Alaskan Malamute and I bought size 8 for him and it fits his giant paws very well! These stayed on and are very durable!!! I have gotten other shoes before and after one walk, there was already a hole on the bottom.... But these shoes have rubber soles and are just perfect for my big guy!
customer_reviews.author: Koda

customer_reviews.title: Rubber wore down significantly in just ONE walk around our neighborhood
customer_reviews.text: Not really meant for concrete. We walked our Golden Retriever one time with these, a 3 mile walk, on a warm day. When we came back, one of them was already worn all the way down. The tread must be very soft and low quality for this to have happened in ONE walk. For the price, I just feel the rubber should be stronger and quality better.
customer_reviews.author: MCF84

customer_reviews.title: Easily Slipped Out of their Size
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 pairs, one for each of my dogs. My girl was measured as a 2 and my boy was measured as a 3. When we put them on, their paws fit correctly onto the pad but they could easily slip out of the velcro straps, which we tightened all of the way. So thinking maybe I bought the wrong size I tried the 2 on my boy. But the 2s were too tight on his paw at the pad and he could still slip out of the velcro straps, which were again tightened all of the way. So we ended up returning because it wasn't an issue of size, rather a poor design for the straps.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Great shies, and reasonably priced!
customer_reviews.text: They stay on pretty well. The sizing chard was very accurate. But one problem is when my dog runs, the shoe will twist out of place or she will lose one shoe here or there. It helps quite a bit because my dog is allergic to grass. If all four stay on, that is one less part of the body I need to wipe down each time she comes back inside. When they eventually wear out (because they will get alot of use) I will definitely order another set. Overall satisfaction if very positive.
customer_reviews.author: cally

customer_reviews.title: These boots are made for walking... and hiking... and playing in the snow :)
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been wearing these boots for the past two years. We've used these boots for hiking, walking through snow, and even hot summer days. He has sensitive paws and they get irritated a lot so these boots have been a life saver a times. I love that it has two straps and that the boots are reflective. The only con I've noticed about these boots is that the velcro tends to get dirty/muddy and it loses its effectiveness but not enough to have them slip out. Also, don't be alarmed if your dog has trouble walking in them at first. It'll take a couple of walks for them to get used to them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This product is not designed for strenuous use..
customer_reviews.text: I have reviewed this product in the past and given it a 5 star review. We have bought this product multiple times to replace boots that have not held up well. To be fair, we have a dog with a genetic condition that is incurable and will necessitate him wearing boots to protect his feet for the rest of his life. We live on property that is fairly rural and add to that he is very active and athletic. This product is just not designed for that amount of strenuous use. We are currently researching other products that will hold up better. Specifically the weakness is in the stitching and gluing.
customer_reviews.author: RockinRon

customer_reviews.title: Love them!  Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked beautiful! Fit perfectly! We just did four national parks in Arizona in 4 days! Saved my puppies paws! Purchased a pair for each of my dogs and never had a single issue! Temperatures ranged from 97 to 116 and their paws stayed cool! And with the tread they could run. And so many people complimented them on their shoes. And said how intelligent it was to put them on. Definitely will buy more when I need to replace them. And neither of my dogs tried to take them off. And this is the first time either if them wore shoes on their feet! Both wear size 7
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, then blood
customer_reviews.text: When we first got these for our lab we thought they were the prefect solution to our problems with the salt/ ice remover on the streets and sidewalks burning out dog’s feet. Our dog accepted the shoes and wore them and walked in them and they seemed prefect. The fit was prefect. Then we noticed small bloody spots on the tops of his paws. The inside of the boot is soft, but when you tighten the straps it creates folds that cut into his feet. So they are pretty much not wearable. Now I see others have had similar problems.
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I have been asked multiple times by "M Busy Pet" to write a review. I was going to keep my mouth shut, but since they have asked so many times here I go... Garbage product, I followed their sizing specs, still wrong size. Will not stay on my dogs paws and flew off in 4 different directions the 1st steps he took. Velcro is tiny, does not allow for good grip... I'll just go back to wiping his paws when its muddy ... Hope this review helps.
customer_reviews.author: N. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: different boots fit different dogs
customer_reviews.text: I am learning different boots fit different dogs. I really wanted these to work but my dog who has a 1.75" width and a 2.25 length just did not work well with these boots. unfortunately all boots are not sized to fit a length and width so it is trial and error. the length of the boot was too long for his width and he tripped as he was walking constantly. had to return them. not the fault of the manufacturing quality, more because the length was way too long for his width. if you have a short paw length not the boot for you
customer_reviews.author: netrunnr

customer_reviews.title: This doesn't even deserve the one star.
customer_reviews.text: I followed the measurement instructions and ordered what the measurement equation table guided me to as the right size. They fit across the toes but there is no way that these boots are going to fit this dog. The rubber tread doesn't even cover the entire foot pad she will essentially be walking on the nylon upper thus destroying the boots in a matter of one walk around the block. it is totally unacceptable to spend this kind of money for one trip around the block. The equation table needs to be modified to real dog foot sizes or clarified as to how to measure and obtain the correct size the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Leona D. Mackinney

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great protection, excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: These are the second set I've bought for my GSD puppy. The first set is still in great shape, he just outgrew them. The contact I've had with the company has been very good, they seem to really care about their customers and want us to be successful with their product. I recommend these boots for all my dog training clients as well as recommending them to anyone who asks about them when they see my dogs out and about while wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: NV Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for Corgies
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Corgies, and unfortunately, the boots would not stay on. They have big feet for little dogs, but have comparitively slender legs and short "ankles". I didnt want to tighten the velcro so much that their circulation would be cut off, but that meant the extra material at the ankle was folded uncomfortably, and the boots were just shaken off after just a couple steps. I think dog boots should be designed with a bend, instead of straight "tubes" so they would better align with the shape of a dog's foot.
customer_reviews.author: Nuggiepup

customer_reviews.title: Previously had the expensive Ruff Wear boots and I liked them but the could have been better
customer_reviews.text: Previously had the expensive Ruff Wear boots and I liked them but the could have been better. These are half the price and the double Velcro strap is more legit than ruff wear single strap. Used for Trail Running down hill. The uphill hiking 3-6000 ft. Elevation climb is ok on my boxer/lab's paws but running down can tear up herself paws. These were great. Put them on at the mountain top and it's like she got a second wind of energy and started tearing up the mountain. Hopefully they last 50-100 hard miles. For the price you can't beat them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Important
customer_reviews.text: Everything about these shoe are great, my only complaint is the way they sit on my corgi. He measured 2.5 so I bought a size 3 to be safe, not until it snowed and his paws were wet that I noticed that where the top was rubbing on my poor little guys paw to where it was bleeding 😭.
customer_reviews.author: Pachy

customer_reviews.title: My Busy Dog Water Resistant Dog Shoes
customer_reviews.text: We love these water resistant dog shoes!!! Our small 7 pound Chi mix is in training with his new shoes, first inside the house and now outside in our Maine snow. He loves not getting his paws all covered in clumps of snow and ice. These boots are fantastic, they protect not only during the ice and snow season, but also during the hot summer on pavement. These little guys need to keep their paws protected....big guys too! Thank you so much My Busy Dog for this great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, have only had a few instances of one ...
customer_reviews.text: We just moved to AZ and our dog couldn't walk outside without risking injury to all 4 paws, so these booties are a life saver. So far so good, have only had a few instances of one falling off but we strap them more securely now and haven't had any issues. Would highly recommend these if you live in a hot urban area with dry heat!
customer_reviews.author: Samanda

customer_reviews.title: Not for Danes....
customer_reviews.text: The material is great, and I'm sure these work on smaller dogs, but these did not work at all for my Great Danes. I measured the width per the instructions, and while they fit fine width wise, these are not nearly long enough to stay on the paw. It looked like the dogs were wearing crocs. These really need to taper up the leg more so they stay on. I'm sure most of the comments regarding the shoes not staying on are due to the fact that the shoes do not strap to the dog's leg at a high enough point.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff & Shanna Carl

customer_reviews.title: Swim tested with great results!
customer_reviews.text: After hours at the lake my poor golden retriever’s paw pads were sore and took days to heal. Found these booties and took him on a 2 mile hike down to the lake, hung out for a few hours, then walked back. Took the booties off in the car and NO SORE PAW PADS ANYMORE! It took him a bit to walk right in then, but he swam and hiked in these with no problems. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: BellaMarissa

customer_reviews.title: YOU get to pay for their inaccurate sizing!
customer_reviews.text: If you are unsure of your dog's fit, do not buy this item. The sizing chart takes only width into account. If your dog has long, narrow feet, they will not work. And if you try to return them, they expect YOU to pay a minimum of $6.18 for return shipping, meaning you just wasted your time, and your out $$ from your own pocket. Or, if you're getting the next size up, you just wasted your time AND paid more than everyone else for the same item. Not I. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for hiking.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for my Shepherd/Collie Mix for hiking. For reference she’s 62 lbs and we ordered a size 5 after measuring her paws. They fit her perfect. So far she has used them for muddy hikes and walked in them fine after she got used to them. However we do not recommend them for running or sprinting which she likes to do. She tried sprinting with them and she slips so we just use them for walks and hikes. With hiking they prevented her paws from getting all dirty or hurt from thorns. We also check her feet often to make sure they aren’t irritating or hurting her feet.
customer_reviews.author: Ortiz4

customer_reviews.title: Very thick and sturdy but some flaw in design
customer_reviews.text: Very thick and sturdy but after wearing them for a week, I notice that by tightening the strap, the design creates folds which pinch and rub on my dog upper paws and causing them to bleed. Unfortunately they are not the right fit for my dog.. I ordered small and my dog is a 7lbs poodle mix
customer_reviews.author: ethe

customer_reviews.title: Not great for larger dogs.
customer_reviews.text: We thought with all the amazing reviews these would for sure be the right shoes for our older GSD mix. She has trouble walking on hardwood floors, doesn't have a high activity level. These shoes refused to stay on her paws for more then 5 minutes of normal walking even after making the straps tight and secure. Quality wise I would say they are well made. But not really worth the price tag after seeing many different brands and makes. Overall these are well made but just not suited for large breeds, even with the correct sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great boots
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots! My dog wouldn't go for walks this winter for the first time, apparently because her paws bothered her. I had to carry her home a few times before I got these. I had my son get ready to video her the first time I put them on, because I've seen so many funny videos of dogs first walking with boots. She took to them immediately - no walking funny at all. I was actually disappointed! She is very excited to put them on because she knows what's coming. I'm so glad I found these.
customer_reviews.author: Sewing Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoes for dogs!!!
customer_reviews.text: These things were awesome for my dog! He wore them for 12 miles on the Appalachian Trail and only 1 came off the entire time. He went through stream, mud, rock, open field. He ran, swam and dug in the mud and water without issue. He is 105lb black lab, I bought the size 8 black and they fit perfect for him. Besides dirt, they ended the trip in good shape. Soles showed little, if any, wear after their first trip. These are great and would recommend them for your dog! They got wet. Worked fine. They got muddy. Worked fine. Dry rocks and rough trail. Worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: camp-a-tron

customer_reviews.title: My pup loves them, perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my 45 pound golden retriever. I got size 6 and they fit perfectly. I also sized her with the guide picture 8 times before I purchased. She loves them. She knows it’s time to go outside when I pull them out. She can also run as fast as she normally does without them when we take her biking. If I don’t tighten the top Velcro enough then it will turn upside down while she is running. Other than that no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Take your measurements
customer_reviews.text: Our yard tends to get really muddy in the winter and it was such a hassle cleaning him every time he comes in. Now, it easy to put on and take off and simply rinse it off and dry it before he has to go out and again. There are two right and and two left shoes so make sure you put it on right. The yellow paws face each other. Do take the measurements yourself. While the chart size worked pretty good for me, I can see how a tiny difference in the size can make them not work well
customer_reviews.author: ErenyY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Arizona heat!
customer_reviews.text: I was really hesitant buying dog shoes in general because of the reviews of literally every single one I selected. But these are AWESOME! I definitely recommend. I measured as reccomended and she happened to be a perfect fit! Great long lasting materials and perfect thicker shoe rubber for the Arizona heat! My dog has so much fun in them - she has an extra burst of energy almost immediately after they're on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mixed results, YMMV with a less active dog.
customer_reviews.text: Tough to say where I stand on these. On the one hand, they always seem to rotate 180 degrees so my dog is walking on the top. It seems to me that if they made the grippy surface all the way around, the result would be a lot better for dogs that like to change direction a lot. On the other hand, all dog shoes that I've seen seem to be made just this way. Regardless, the rotation has caused holes to appear in the top unprotected portion of the shoe. Not terribly impressed with longevity, though they do at least stay on my dog's feet well.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Z

customer_reviews.title: Horrible shape and it is even dangerous for a dog to wear it.
customer_reviews.text: This boot are whatever but boots for a dog. Whoever design this boots didn't even think about the shape of an animals paws. The material is very hard, which could be a pro if the boots had the wright shape. However it is very difficult to accommodate to the animal's paw. And if finally fit on the dogs paw, then it hurts the skin. I blame my self on buying those worthless boots after I saw the pictures of those dog's paws bleeding... It is sad that people could care less about the animals need and think just about making money.....
customer_reviews.author: hoosier mom

customer_reviews.title: These boots did a wonderful job all weekend long
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these boots for my dog. We needed them to protect his paws, while quail hunting in Arizona. These boots did a wonderful job all weekend long. The desert washes and sharp rocks are always hard on the dogs paws. My dog wore the boots all weekend long and not one came off (other boots have) which I was impressed with. Great product and recommended them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Morey

customer_reviews.title: Helpful shoes for sensitive paws.
customer_reviews.text: I really appreciate the thought behind these, but it really depends on the dog, not you. The first couple tries my dog tried to lick them off, lmao, and even sometimes would “scrape” the ground after a piddle and figured out that the reverse action would pull them off!! So she keeps trying but she is slowly getting used to them. So we will keep these and keep trying. If they went a little bit higher on then leg I think that would help even more.
customer_reviews.author: Coletrain

customer_reviews.title: Stayed on, despite running through snow.
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the ability of these to stay on my service dog's feet, and with the level of comfort she got from them. It took her a couple times of wearing them to not mind something being on her feet, but once she realized she could run around in the snow without pain, she was game. I didn't give 5 stars because they did have some thread fraying very quickly, I want to say on the second or third time wearing them, but that hasn't seemed to effect the functionality so I maintained a four star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Ross k.

customer_reviews.title: Great dog boots.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to help our dog with the hot Phoenix pavement. We had tried a suede set from another manufacturer, but on our first outing they split a seem. We saw good reviews on Amazon for this pair from My Busy Pet and gave them a try. First off, the sizing chart was simple to understand. Ours arrived and fit perfectly. We let our dog walk around the house a few hours a day for a couple of days (very amusing) and them took her a good walk around the neighborhood. Hot pavement, gravel, no problems. They never slipped off. No chafing issues. Over all we are very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: DandKc.

customer_reviews.title: One happy goldendoodle!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! I bought a second pair because the treads were gone. My dog wears these shoes every time we go outside. Whether it is going hiking, running, shopping, or bathroom runs, these are great. It took her about 10 minutes to get used to the shoes (1st pair a year ago). Not too bad! They do not slide down or slip off. Will keep buying in the future!
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Hold up well
customer_reviews.text: Our dog has worn these on a daily basis for several months, they hold up well to both gravel roads and city streets. The velcro straps are a bit of a challenge, but do the job well. Ordered another pair so we won't have to wait when these finally wear out. The dog loves the traction they give her and we love the protection for her pads. We were surprised to find that she doesn't dislike them, she had a few minutes of adjusting to the feel, and now cooperates with the procedure to put them on.
customer_reviews.author: L. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Big Dog Kicks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes after my Pit ripped the paw pads and nails off all four of his feet chasing a squirrel...Sad, for a week he could not walk and was in pain....I put these on his feet and he was up and running again...he loves them and knows when he has them on he can chase whatever he wants over rocks or hot concrete and will not damage his paws...these are the best...I did purchase others that he refuses to let us put on him...he gets excited when he sees these and lets us put them on him without any problem...nice part, they stay on until we remove them
customer_reviews.author: BS

customer_reviews.title: Great product good protection for the weather and rough terrain..
customer_reviews.text: I love these and my dogs love them. The price is good for the produt. I have never had the issue some reporta and pic IV seen on here. Are you putting Sox on your dog and how long are you keeping them on your dogs. And are you guys mesuring the dogs paws right. Cus my dogs only wear them when the weather is bad and not more than 5 hours maybe. Bare or with Sox. But I do suggest putting Sox on the dog that may be the issue or the shoes you order are the wrong size or your putting them on too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are great for hiking and running around in the desert
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great for hiking and running around in the desert!! We live in Arizona and are always worried about our dog's feet. It was hilarious watching him the first time we put them on, but once he got use to them, they are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cheaply made product. While the exterior looks fine quality the inside of these boots are really bare. If my dog runs with them on the back ones just fly right off. Part of me thinks this is because of the entirely bare inside thy can just slip right off the fur. To counteract this I have to secure them pretty tight and not let her run with them, and hat worries me a bit after seeing all the dogs who have gained sores from these boots post-purchase. For now thy are a 2 star for being pretty cheap quality but if they give my dog a wound easily a 1 star product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!! Almost $40 for useless cheap Chinese junk
customer_reviews.text: People either rave about these, or wonder how people can possibly have anything positive to say. Some people say they receive a quality product, and some people think they are getting a cheap knock-off from China. There is no possible way that these could possibly stay on a dog's foot. I have 3 dogs, 5lb, 13lbs, and 18lbs, and they wouldn't stay on any of them, Andy they were rough on the inside, with rigid rubber seams. I'm assuming that I received the cheap knock-off's from China.....and now have to pay $6.18 to return them (in spite of being a Prime Member, and not seeing anything about paying to return). Disappointed!! Almost $40 for useless cheap Chinese junk.....
customer_reviews.author: TAWNY HELENE WHITAKER

customer_reviews.title: Real quality of life improvement for an old dog
customer_reviews.text: We have an old retriever who is losing the use of his back legs, probably due to degenerative neuropathy. On slippery floors, he couldn't stand up sometimes before we got these shoes, now vinyl and hardwood floors are no problem. Don't just leave them on, though- they need to be taken off at least at night. Dog refused the front feet but no problem with the rear, where it was needed. They do tend to twist when he lays down, so minus one star.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Worth the higher price
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality and ease of use. My dog had never worn any type of boot and she hates having her paws touched. We moved to Colorado and using boots became a necessity. Took her awhile to adjust but was easier than other boots because these have the ability to adjust the 2 velcro straps. The material is perfect and durable. She does not slip in snow or ice and has adjusted well to use. Manufacturer stated these are for both cold and hot weather. I didn't know this but will definitely be using these for both weather extremes. Don't skip these because of the higher price. Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Kymberly

customer_reviews.title: There should possibly be some cushion or lining in the shoes
customer_reviews.text: Each time my dog wears the shoes he whines and occasionally limps. Originally I thought his nails might have been too long but the last time he wore them, I had just clipped his nails. He has other shoes he wears with no problem. These I believe are too hard inside, ,
customer_reviews.author: Delbert

customer_reviews.title: These are the equivalent of ankle socks. Sometimes, ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the equivalent of ankle socks. Sometimes, you just need the half-calf ones to stay on. My 80lb black lab kicks these off regardless of how tight they are after a while, but they do the job against salted roads and sidewalks. They could use a re-design.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Serves purpose and good for a laugh
customer_reviews.text: We like our carpet to remain clean and after Benny (10lb mini schnauzer) goes outside after it's rained his paws get very muddy. These shoes work great. Benny thought he was in trouble when we put em on him but got used to em after a while. Prepare to die laughing if you've never seen a dog walk with shoes on for the first time. They fit true to the scale available. Don't be afraid to tighten the velcro straps as much as possible because they'll slip off if you don't. Easy to clean and I'm sure he'll appreciate them when it starts snowing. These appear to be very well made.
customer_reviews.author: James Abbott

customer_reviews.title: I looove them, they stay in place...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought my dog other boots that just kept falling, and that rotate when she walked, they were just a waste of money. These ones stay in place and are really up for the job. I saw some reviews where they hurt the paws, so I bought baby socks to put under. So far so good, there is no sings of bleeding and my pup loooves them, she runs and jumps in snow and her paws are dry and warm. My pup is a miniature schnauzer: her paws measure 1.6 in width and I bought the size 2: with the baby socks , it fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Mpina

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth it
customer_reviews.text: Ok, now here's a REAL review of the product. All in all, the dog shoes/boots seem to be made decently but definitely not worth the $40 by any means, maybe $20-25. The problem is that the size and design for the shoes/boots is wrong, mainly the back feet. I measured 3-4 times at different times just to make sure I had the same measurements. The shoes/boots move around while in use, so the top part ends up in the water or mud and gets ruined. I have ZERO DESIRE to buy another pair. IF THIS WOULD HAVE BEEN AN AMERICAN MADE PRODUCT IT WOULD BE GREAT BUT IT'S MADE IN CHINA AND IT'S NOT GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton G.

customer_reviews.title: It also comes up to a knobby part of her foot and I think it will rub funny on longer walks
customer_reviews.text: Dog can finally walk around in the ice and salt. Takes a few minutes to get them on her. They are slippery. She slides in them quite a bit. Wish the bottoms where a bit grippier. I'll probably buy some longer ones. I noticed today in a few inches of snow that some of the snow get in the boots. It also comes up to a knobby part of her foot and I think it will rub funny on longer walks. I might also buy some thin socks. You have to latch them down snug and they seem to stay on pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE: May send you used shoes!
customer_reviews.text: The product has a lot of potential, but I didn’t appreciate being sent evidently used shoes with a “new” sticker attached to them. There was dog hair all over them and lots of dirt marks inside the shoes. Upon closer inspection, the shoe fabric material was also a little rough yet flimsy in certain places; I don’t expect these shoes to last for more than a handful of trips before you’ll need to buy more. Overall, I suggest skipping out on this product; there are many options out there and one that may sell you used and flimsy shoes may not be worth your money.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: We love hiking with our dogs
customer_reviews.text: We love hiking with our dogs. We often go for quicker 10 mile hikes as well as 20 mile backpacking trips. The dogs NEED paw protection for these trips.I couldn't believe how well these stayed on our mastiff mix's paws. I bought size 7 for her (she's 100 lbs). Our german shorthair uses a smaller size. 8 miles in, and the shoes were still secure! It wasn't until we went through a river that one came off, but their feet needed to dry off anyhow. I highly recommend these. Our german shorthair has had his shoes for 5+ years, and they are still holding up well!
customer_reviews.author: Chelle

customer_reviews.title: Too small to fit back paws
customer_reviews.text: The Velcro came off the straps. I have a German Shepard and these were too small. All the shoes are the same size, the back paw shoes need to be much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Moriah20

customer_reviews.title: Don't stay on the dog. Sharp inside in places
customer_reviews.text: Check theses boots when you get them. I found several sharp areas inside these boots. I got tennis wristbands to protect my dogs feet from these boots. If my dog runs, they fall off every time. Not good for hiking or running after the ball or any sort of play. They are cute, have a nice no skid sole. I would not boy them again, or recommend them. I am doing more research on dog boots, so I can replace them. They work okay for a placid leash walk, as long as you have something on your dogs feet to protect them from contact with the boots.
customer_reviews.author: Gisele R.

customer_reviews.title: Looks good for regular walks
customer_reviews.text: I got these for burrs and goatheads on a trail. They seem good and should work OK. Obviously, the dog didn't like them at first but they were easy to put on and stayed on for a short walk. I don't know that they would stand up to extended hunting or really long hikes but they worked fine for me in the limited trial. Just remember to not tighten the velcro too much or it can restrict blood flow on the dogs feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and wonderful company !!!!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are an answered prayer. Our 10 year old German Shepard Chance suffered a stroke two weeks ago. Recovery has been slow but we are on the way. Putting these shoes on Chance enables him to walk on the hard wood floors in our house with so much more ease. The shoes are well built and fit perfect. Furthermore My Busy Dog the supplier reached out to us directly with tips on using the shoes and offered solid recommendations. Thank you. We highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Fall off right away
customer_reviews.text: Didn't stay on my dogs feet for even a minute. Granted my dog is quite small, a 10lb terrier. But I was disappointed they wouldn't stay on his feet at all. Wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Taren

customer_reviews.title: Great Dog Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old large breed dog has arthritis in her hips so doesn't lift her feet high enough when she walks causing a few of her nails to scrap and bleed. I put her fancy red boots on and she can now walk pain free galloping around sounding like a small pony from the clopping of the rubber.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly D.

customer_reviews.title: My dog looked like Bambi trying to get used to them
customer_reviews.text: At first I was worried I'd have to throw these out. My dog looked like Bambi trying to get used to them. He also didn't want to go for a walk, and he'd raise his right back leg and go on three legs when he did walk! However, after only like 3 trials with some treats for reinforcement, he is now used to them and trots along fine. Make sure you velcro them on tight so they don't fall off. they protect his feet very well, and he doesn't seem to mind them now once he starts walking.
customer_reviews.author: lindog

customer_reviews.title: We hang out there for several hours and she has a fantastic time just watching people and she has a great ...
customer_reviews.text: We recently moved to Downtown Phoenix and are now urbanites and living in an upscale apartment. This means we have to take our little Laybug out to go potty and where she LOVES the walks, her little paws in this Arizona heat and especially on asphalt would absolutely burn her little paws to bits if we didn't have these gems! They fit perfectly!! Sunday afternoons after returning from church, we pick her up with her shoes on and walk her to a local coffee shop. We hang out there for several hours and she has a fantastic time just watching people and she has a great time!!
customer_reviews.author: laylabug

customer_reviews.title: Our dog didn't like them, but they're great quality.
customer_reviews.text: We got these because our property is pretty muddy when it rains, and our dog (a Cavapoo) has mostly white fur. He didn't like them, but they worked. He's pretty stubborn, and we're a little lazy, so eventually it was too much of a hassle for us to get them on him. But if your dog is easy-going, you should have no problem. Build-wise, they're pretty rugged, and seem like they're sturdy and well-made.
customer_reviews.author: Lizz + Michael

customer_reviews.title: These don't work well
customer_reviews.text: My dog looked like a baby giraffe trying to walk in these. We tried practicing in the house, we tried the high value treats, we tried everything. It did not work. This was a terrible investment. She would not even go outside with them. She just lay down by the door. When I picked her up and put her down on the sidewalk, she lay down on the sidewalk. She hated these boots. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: NYMom

customer_reviews.title: They are nice and thick soles
customer_reviews.text: These are heavy duty doggie boots. We have a 75 pound lab mix and we got them for him for when we go to the hot weather on vacation so that he can walk on the pavement if needed without burning his feet. They are nice and thick soles, easy to put on and off and he is able to get them off with some work but most of the times we "tested" them on him in the house he walked funny for a few minutes and then just went with them and laid down. I think these are a great product
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Great help with rainy weather or hot concrete
customer_reviews.text: Be ready to video when you put these on your dog for the first time as it is a hoot. They do a high stepping walk that is fall down funny. Once they get used to walking with them, they like them. They take off running and it sounds like a horse galloping away. They keep the mud off their feet in the rain and also work great for keeping their paws safe from hot concrete/pavement in the summer. I'm very happy I got them. I have two Golden Doodles and they both wear the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: help if I can

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: My dog hated these at first and could not walk in them. He was always tripping himself, falling or walking like Bambi but we kept using them and now he walks so good in them and he loves them! He was always dragging his back right leg and couldn't go as far as he wanted to but now we can take him on a long walk and only the shoe gets warn out and not his paw. TIP: Works good if you put the straps tight! It doesn't hurt at all and helps the shoe not turn!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler & Jeanette Quinata

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: These are a good boot for dogs. We have only been able to use them once as they got soaked and rubbed our dog a little on the outside toe. Recommend these but break them in an hour or less at a time. Our doberman wasnt sure about them at first but ended up liking them. We went through creeks and on difficult terrain and they didnt slow her down one bit. The only bad thing is the velcro comes undone after it gets wet.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Measure Twice, Order Once
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you measure your dog's feet correctly for these. I erred on the side of caution and went a little big and ended up having to order a second pair in a smaller size. Even the second pair I think may be a little on the big side, but I have a quickly growing pup, so she should soon fit them. It took her a little while to get used to them and even after wearing them at least once daily for a week she still walks funny when the first go on her feet. But she runs just as fast as ever with them.
customer_reviews.author: Erich Zann

customer_reviews.title: Great protection!
customer_reviews.text: These are great to protect paw pads. I use this with my 16 lb pup with short fat little legs and they stay on great as long as I take the time to adjust them right. He took to them right away without too much fuss and doesn't try to get them off once distracted. I use them in a warm climate and to also protect when they apply fertilizer to the grass where we walk. These are a great quality and good value for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Julie B

customer_reviews.title: Best dog boots, paws down.
customer_reviews.text: I got a set of these for each of my labs. I'm super impressed with these. They are quick and easy to put on and once on my dogs can run like crazy and they STAY ON! These are the best boots I've had for them by a long shot. Two tips. 1. Make sure these are on tight. (not cut off circulation tight but tight enough they don't slip when you pull on them). 2. MEASURE THE PAWS! Make sure to measure like the company advises. If they fit well they will not only stay on better but also be more comfortable for your pup.
customer_reviews.author: MN Person

customer_reviews.title: Not for Large Breeds
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a set of Size 8 for my Saint Bernard, based on the measurement chart for his paw width. When they arrived, I knew immediately they probably wouldn't fit. But I tried anyway. Width was OK, but I could only fit half of his paw into the boot. The boots are too narrow at the toes, and too short. Boot proportions are all wrong for this size dog. I would have taken a picture, but his foot dwarfs the boot. Definitely not for the big boys. Maybe a size 12? Sent these back.
customer_reviews.author: Jim H.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. These work fantastic. I bought these to protect my girl's feet from the hot pavement. They seem to be good quality. I had to put in some time and effort to get my dog used to walking in them, but she doesn't seem to mind. I just wish they had a smaller size available as we are using the smallest size but could have gone down a size of possible. I will but these again when she eventually wears them out.
customer_reviews.author: Slashlilystar

customer_reviews.title: Well-Made, Adjustable Booties
customer_reviews.text: These fit well and seem to be made very well. I really like the dual Velcro straps for a better fit. I don't think my rescue has ever had booties, and she was a bit baffled; but despite her dislike of foot-handling, she was not overly upset, so I'm assuming they're not uncomfortable. We just have to do more practice to adjust. Our winter is prematurely harsh, so I'm grateful to have foot protection this year, especially since our management is so heavy-handed with salt.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen McBrair

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy cover
customer_reviews.text: We have a German Shepherd that had a spinal stroke and lost some mobility of her right rear leg. When we walk her she tends to drag that leg a little more. Now her left leg has arthritis and we use a wheelchair to alleviate the stress on her hind legs when walking. With the wheelchair she still uses her back legs but tends to still drag the right leg. We use these to protect her foot. The rubber has stood up to her dragging and has worked great. Since we only need 1 we have 3 back ups once the other wears down. We tried a few other shoes and this one has held up the best. Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Kane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality but perhaps for short-hair dogs
customer_reviews.text: So many reviews here are about protecting dogs' paws from hot pavement, but in Minnesota, we need to protect their paws from freezing and, for dogs with long fur between their toes, collecting ice. If you're like me, you've tried boots for your dog before and are still looking for ones that work. The sizing chart above is accurate and very helpful. My collies have thick leg feathers, which could be why the booties didn't stay on. But their design and materials are excellent. So I plan to pick up some clippers, shave my dogs' ankles, and try again!
customer_reviews.author: Dorian H.

customer_reviews.title: Very good fit.
customer_reviews.text: These are a bit pricey but honestly worth every penny. I measured my dog's paws exactly as the instructions say and when they came they fit perfectly. She definitely was not happy having them on her feet at first but she got used to them quickly and forgot all about them once we started running. I had no issues with them slipping or falling off even after a few hours of running along side my bike. I highly recommend these to protect against hot pavement, glass, sharp rocks etc while you are hiking or biking with your dog (not for constant everyday use). They are worth it if you are highly active with your dog.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to a cone of shame
customer_reviews.text: Our dog had a sore on one foot. He would chew on his foot until it was bleeding all over. We had the cone of shame on him for months trying to keep him from chewing on his foot, but every once in a while he would get it again before it was all healed. These booties covered his sore and he has ignored it. They have lasted for a long time! He only uses one at a time, and the others are spares, so we can rotate putting them through the washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Riley P.

customer_reviews.title: These boots are pretty good for my Labrador retriever.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Easy to put on. - My dog took these on easily enough. - The inside of the boots seem nice and comfortable. - They have a nice look to them. Cons: - I wish the rubber soles were a bit more resisitent to use. I have had these for my dog for a few months now and the bottoms are getting worn. Overall I am happy with this purchase and would recommend them to others.
customer_reviews.author: Maria L.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: They fit my dogs paws perfectly. He was stubborn with them at first, but once he got used to them, he was ready to hit the road. I took him out for a walk and the traction was so good that he ended up walking me. I do reccomend tightening the straps a bit tight. He did the kick after peeing and one shoe flew off, but that was because I didnt tighten the strap. I love how it has reflectors so incoming cars were able to spot him and slow down. Overall, it was a great buy! If you have a pitbull, I reccomend getting size 5.
customer_reviews.author: Mixunamii

customer_reviews.title: Great for those 100+ degree weather days
customer_reviews.text: The boots worked out great. First time using them, two of the boots came off and I thought they weren't going to work out. The second time, I tightened them up a bit more and no issues at all. Out here in Arizona, the sidewalks get super hot. These boots definitely make a difference. Only took a couple walks for my dog to get used to wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: TPAGE

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING PAW PROTECTION!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my "fur-nephew" who lives in Florida. His walks in the morning are fine but the afternoon is simply too hot for his paws. While it took him a day or two to adjust to these funny things on his paws, he can now walk his normal 2-3 miles in the afternoon without causing sore paws. They have excellent traction, fit exactly as promised (be sure to measure your dog's paw as explained in the video), wash very well, dry quickly. Don't hesitate to invest in these paw boots to protect your dog's paws. They are worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Boots are doing their job
customer_reviews.text: Thus far we are very happy with the dog boots. Our 12 year old lab is dragging his hind legs now and his rear paws are a mess. These boots are easy to put on and are doing a great job protecting his paws.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: even better, avoid if you have an old (frail) dog
customer_reviews.text: Soles are stiff which seems very unnatural for a dog. Mine cannot walk in them and appears glued to the floor when wearing them. It was hilarious until I started to worry about her safety because she almost did a face plant. Definitely be cautious or, even better, avoid if you have an old (frail) dog. They look cute, but are not being used. I'll give an extra star because they seem well made.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: 90lb Goldendoodle Approved!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 90lbs GoldenDoodle and we live in northern Wisconsin, one Lake Superior. There is a lot of ice, deep snow, and subzero weather. These shoes do a great job and I get a lot of compliments from other people stating how nice they look. The bonus is when everything starts to thaw and is muddy outside, we put on these boots and our carpet stays cleaner longer. By the way, putting on the shoes are super easy. It probably adds two minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Good but . . .
customer_reviews.text: Our Corgi has been getting cold feet here in Duluth, Minnesota, so we tried these boots. We did get them to fit, and they do keep her from lifting her feet in pain, but she doesn't like to wear them at all. Time will tell whether she gets used to them. So, yes, they did the trick, but for her it's a hard sell.
customer_reviews.author: Judith C. Andersonbauer

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them. Velcro weak.
customer_reviews.text: There are problems with the velcro straps - particularly the upper ones that don't stay fastened, but my dog loves them. It is hard for him to run on the icy snow and he'd get cuts in his pads making him very tentative when going outside. Not with these on. He asks for them now and runss like the wind.
customer_reviews.author: M. Webster

customer_reviews.title: Not Good for an Active Dog
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes as well as a very nice extreme weather warm insulated jacket for my female chocolate lab, to spend long days with me out on frozen open lakes ice fishing. I ordered these the end of this past December, and after only her third time wearing, each shoe is showing threading and fabric frayer on the velcro straps, and one strap has split, another beginning to split. Disappointed considering what they cost. I may see if I can return them, and will have to look for some other brand or alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Edwards

customer_reviews.title: They Work!
customer_reviews.text: My wire hair fox terrier is 13 and is beginning to drag his left rear leg due to age related neurological issues. We bought these to protect the top surface of his paw from injury while he walks. The bootie not only stays on but also acts as a supportive prosthetic by keeping the paw in a more normal position. We keep the bootie on about 8 hours a day and have not had any issues with it falling off. The fitting chart worked as described. I highly recommend this product. We, and our dog, are very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Fox

product_meta.title: My Busy Dog Water Resistant Dog Shoes with Two Reflective Fastening Straps and Rugged Anti-Slip Sole | Dog Boots Perfect for Small Medium Large Dogs | Size Chart in Pictures
feature_bullets: RUGGED: Tough waterproof anti slip sole provides stability and traction, protection from sharp thorns, hot pavement and asphalt in the summer, salt and snow during the cold winter months.

QUALITY: Our shoes have a rugged sole and high quality fabrics that are then sewn together (not glued like cheaper dog boots) to ensure they are ready for your adventure. Easy to put on / off. The shoe expands with a wide split seam opening and two adjustable and reflective fastening straps to ensure a tight and secure fit.

SIZING: Use the size chart located in the pictures to determine the right size shoe for your dog's paws. We are also available to help you select the right size - just contact us directly and we can assist you with all of your dog boot needs.

CONVENIENT: Water resistant shoes keep paws dry and warm. No more wiping muddy or sandy paws after the rain or snow. Helps dogs with mobility and stability on tile and hardwood floors. Also helps protect nails and paws for dogs that drag their rear paws due to arthritis.

TESTED BY MY FAMILY. PERFECT FOR YOURS. As a small, family run, USA business your happiness is our top priority. All of our products are built so that your dog can join you everywhere - just like our two dogs do. Each purchase helps a dog in need with our “Paw for Paw” program. We look forward to seeing you in our #MyBusyDog gear!

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
